channel.title: Home on Rock 'n' Roh
channel.description: Recent content in Home on Rock 'n' Roh

item.title: Bootstrapping and its application in R
item.description: Setting Perform multiple tests at once Concise and easily interpretable results T-test References Setting As part of my teaching assistant position in a Belgian university, students often ask me for some help in their statistical analyses for their master’s thesis. A frequent question is how to compare groups of patients in terms of several quantitative continuous variables. Most of us know that: To compare two groups, a Student’s t-test should be used1 To compare three groups or more, an ANOVA should be performed These two tests are quite basic and have been extensively documented online and in statistical textbooks so the difficulty is not in how to perform these tests.

item.title: Another Note on A blogdown Tutorial
item.description: I just discovered an awesome tutorial on blogdown written by Alison. I have to admit this is the best blogdown tutorial I have seen so far.

item.title: A Quick Note on Two Beautiful Websites
item.description: To me, the two most impressive websites based on blogdown are: Rob J Hyndman’s personal website. Live Free or Dichotomize by Lucy and Nick et al. I’m sure there will be more.

item.title: A Plain Markdown Post
item.description: This sample post is mainly for blogdown users. If you do not use blogdown, you can skip the first section. 1. Markdown or R Markdown This is a post written in plain Markdown (*.md) instead of R Markdown (*.Rmd). The major differences are: You cannot run any R code in a plain Markdown document, whereas in an R Markdown document, you can embed R code chunks (```{r}); A plain Markdown post is rendered through Blackfriday, and an R Markdown document is compiled by rmarkdown and Pandoc.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.

item.title: Teaching Experiences 및 교육 컨설팅 (과외)
item.description: ____________________________________________________________________________________________________ Teaching Assistant (TA) & Grader Positions University of Chicago (UoC) / 시카고대학교 2020 Winter: Econometricss  -  Syllabus, TA Evaluation [Bachelor Course] 2019 Autumn: Statistical Methods in Economics  -  Syllabus, TA Evaluation [Bachelor Course] 2020 Winter: Introduction to Stochastic Calculus  -  Syllabus, Grader [Master Course] 2019 Winter: Portfolio Theory and Risk Management I  -  Syllabus, Grader [Master Course] Students are invited to visit Uchicago Canvas to download teaching materials for these courses.

item.title: Who is behind this blog?
item.description: Hello, this is Roh $\rho$ ! Hello, my name is Hyunwoo Roh and you can call me Roh. After finishing the grad school in US and working as consultant/researcher in IT finance company, now I stay in a city called Daegu (Korea) doing civil service for two years. My research interests focus on statistical and machine learning analysis on data related to finance industry. While studying in University of Chicago (UoC), I was a teaching assistant and grader for several courses in statistics, econometrics, and finance courses at bachelor and master’s level.
